brief_summary.textblock:
This study is a multicenter, non-randomized, retrospective study to collect long term (5
      years post-transplant) clinical outcome data to test whether the results of the noninvasive
      immune monitoring test strategy performed in the parent study (CTOT-01, NCT00308802) in
      first six-month post-transplant is predictive of 5-year outcomes. Each center will complete
      a retrospective chart review for the data on patient survival, graft survival and renal
      function.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Retrospective Multicenter Study to Determine 5-Year Clinical Outcomes in Subjects Previously Enrolled in the CTOT-01 Study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Participants previously enrolled in the CTOT-01 study.

          -  Participants who are at least 5 years post-transplant (+/- 6 months), no later than
             March 31, 2014.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Withdrawal of consent to continue in the CTOT-01 study.

study_pop.textblock:
The study population was selected based on their previous participation in the parent
        study (CTOT-01). A total of 280 subjects were enrolled and transplanted in the Clinical
        Trials in Organ Transplantation

link.description: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

facility.name: Cleveland Clinic Foundation, Glickman Urological Institute
University of Manitoba Health Sciences Centre

clinical_study.official_title: A Retrospective Multicenter Study to Determine 5-Year Clinical Outcomes in Subjects Previously Enrolled in the CTOT-01 Study (CTOT-17)

primary_outcome.description: Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) in the adult cohort and Schwartz method in the pediatric cohort
primary_outcome.measure: Change in estimated glomerular filtration Rate (eGFR) from 6 months to 5 years post-transplantation

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient survival as assessed by the incidence of death reported in the first 5 years post- transplant
Graft survival as assessed by the incidence of graft loss reported in the first 5 years post- transplant
Renal function as assessed by the absolute glomerular filtration Rate (GFR) at 5 years post-transplant
Change in Chronic Kidney Disease stages between transplant and 5 years post- transplant

clinical_study.source: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective
